question_text: Which feature makes ECC memory more reliable than parity memory in server environments?
answer_options: ECC uses higher-quality silicon than parity memory
ECC can detect and correct errors without halting the system
ECC modules use less power during idle states
ECC is backward-compatible with DDR2 and DDR3 platforms
correct_answer: ECC can detect and correct errors without halting the system
explanation: Unlike parity memory, ECC memory can correct single-bit errors on the fly, preventing system crashes and improving uptime in critical systems.
